results:
Based on the search results, I found information related to "Wichrowe Wzgórza" (Wuthering Heights) in the context of Polish school education and required reading lists. Here's what I found:

"Wichrowe wzgórza" by E. Brontë appears on reading lists for Polish schools, specifically mentioned in what appears to be a gymnasium reading list. The novel is listed among other classic works that students are expected to read.

The search also revealed information about schools located in the Wichrowe Wzgórze area of Poznań, Poland:

XX Liceum Ogólnokształcące is located at Osiedle Wichrowe Wzgórze 111 in Poznań, and there's also a private school for adults offering high school and gymnasium education at the same address.

The search results show that new reading lists for high schools and technical schools became mandatory starting from the 2021/2022 school year, and there are updated reading lists for the 2024/2025 school year.

Emily Brontë's "Wuthering Heights" (Wichrowe Wzgórza in Polish) remains a part of the curriculum for Polish secondary education, appearing alongside other classic works of world literature that Polish students are required to read during their gymnasium and high school years.
